metadata.title: Top Python Libraries for Data Science | by Claire D. Costa | Towards Data Science
metadata.h1: Top Python Libraries for Data Science
metadata.description: Python has been an exceptionally valuable programming language for not just app development, but also for enabling Data Scientists and Researchers to find solutions to complex computational and…

all_paragraphs: “Python has been an important part of Google since the beginning, and remains so as the system grows and evolves. Today dozens of Google engineers use Python, and we’re looking for more people with skills in this language.”
- Peter Norvig, director of search quality at Google, Inc.

Python has been an exceptionally valuable programming language for not just app development, but also for enabling Data Scientists and Researchers to find solutions to complex computational and mathematical problems. The versatility offered by the programming language effortlessly allows it to be used in a variety of domains with little to no trouble.

What makes Python the ideal choice for Data Scientists is it’s easy to use and debug nature. But calling Python the go-to programming language of choice for Data Science would not be fair without mentioning its diverse collection of libraries and packages.

Python has a lot of packages in its arsenal, over 255 thousand, to be exact. The use case of these packages is spread across a huge variety of domains. As we are on the topic of Data Science, we would like to draw your attention to some of the top Python libraries that are widely used by a vast audience, including Data Scientists, Researchers, Analysts, and many others.
Core Task: Build Deep Learning models

Offered by Google, TensorFlow is an excellent tool for developing and training Machine Learning models and is available for many platforms such as mobile, IoT, and more. It can handle a variety of tasks, such as object recognition, speech recognition, and more.

With TensorFlow’s flexible architecture, developers can easily scale hardware as the need increases, and the included collaboration support makes involving other team members a breeze. Key benefits offered by TensorFlow are:
● Includes tools from the ideation to the final deployment
● Offers powerful resources for research
● Comes with a top-notch community support
● Backed by several popular Google products such as Google Photos and Voice Search
Core task: Developing and training deep learning models
Developed by Facebook’s AI Research Lab for Machine Learning, PyTorch sees its use primarily for tasks related to Computer Vision and Natural Language Processing.

If you find yourself on the lookout for a production-ready machine learning tool that is both fast and efficient, works with a distributed environment and scales effortlessly, PyTorch might be the right option for you.
The major distinct features offered by the open-source Python library PyTorch are:
● Support for tensor computing, powered by robust GPU acceleration, allowing for high-performance operation on multidimensional arrays
● The time-saving automatic differentiation method called Autograd
● A dedicated module to build highly optimized Neural Networks
Welcome to Pytorch Tutorials — https://pytorch.org/tutorials/
Core Task: Build Deep Learning models

Keras was built to simplify and even speed up experimentation with Deep Neural Networks by offering the most optimized solutions and APIs. This open-source Python library leverages several benefits from another powerful library called TensorFlow and provides a collection of building blocks to ease building Deep Neural Networks. A few key takeaways from Keras are:
● Seamless support for distributed training via Graphics Processing Units (GPUs) and Tensor Processing Units (TPUs)
● Diverse deployment capabilities to deploy on the browser, mobile and embedded devices
● Allows faster iteration and deployment of models
The name is derived from the term “panel data”, an econometrics term for datasets that include observations over multiple time periods for the same individuals.
Core task: Data manipulation and analysis

The open-source library Pandas adds superb data manipulation and analysis capabilities to Python, which makes it easy to use, flexible, and fast. With pandas, you can perform tasks such as wrangling, manipulation, and visualization tasks on numerical data as well as time series. Pandas comes with several built-in features, such as:
● Provides a DataFrame object for manipulation and indexing of data
● Suite of tools for reading and writing data in-memory data structures and across a variety of file formats
● Efficient merging and joining of data sets
● Flexible restructuring of data sets
● Smart alignment of data and handling of missing values to better organize the data
Google Trends — Pandas Interest Over Time

Scikit-learn is an open-source Python library written in Python, Cython, C, and C++.Built on top of NumPy, SciPy, and matplotlib, scikit-learn offers a collection of tools for efficient data analysis. Scikit-Learn can be used for various problems involving regression, classification, clustering, dimensionality reduction, model selection, preprocessing, and more. The features that make scikit-learn a better choice are:
● Supports various methods such as Support Vector Machines, Random Forests, Gradient Boosting, K-Means
● Offers optimized performance for several operations like linear algebra, array operations, and much more

Plotly is another useful open-source browser-based graph plotting library for Python and offers upwards of 30 varieties of visualizations covering scientific, 3D, statistical, financial, and much more. The plotly library makes it easier to view the impressive graphs and charts in Jupyter Notebooks, HTML files, and can even be hosted online via the Chart Studio Cloud. A few of the chief benefits offered by Plotly are:
● Offers various options to share and export graphs
● Integrates well with IPython for interactive
● Home to an active community of developers and contributors
Google Trends — Plotly Interest Over Time
Core task: Data Cleaning and Manipulation

NumPy is a powerful open-source Python library for working with n-dimensional arrays and offers an extensive set of tools for numerical operations to achieve enhanced performance and faster execution times. NumPy is being used in a broad range of domains, such as Scientific Computing, Data Science, Machine Learning, Data Visualization, Data Analysis, and more. Key takeaways from NumPy are:
● Provides a collection of standard as well as advanced array operations
● Supports a wide range of platforms, environments, and hardware
● Supportive community of hundreds of active users contributing to the project

NLTK short for Natural Language ToolKit is an open-source collection of libraries and tools for natural language processing. Short for Natural Language ToolKit, the library gives you access to over 50 linguistic resources for anyone working with natural language. This includes tools for classification, tagging, stemming, parsing, tokenization, and other related tasks, and is suitable for students, researchers, analysts, and educators.
The library sees its use in a variety of research domains, including Artificial Intelligence, Linguistics, Data Science, Machine Learning, and more. Key benefits of NLTK include:
● Widely famous among educational institutions teaching computational linguistics and workplaces working with natural language
● Python makes for easier access to Natural Language Processing
● It comes with comprehensive documentation, an introductory book, and APIs to make full use of the library

SciPy is a multi-domain and open-source Python library for Data Science that covers science, mathematics, and engineering. The core components that make the SciPy ecosystem are NumPy, SciPy Library, Matplotlib, IPython, SymPy, and Pandas, allowing it to be used efficiently in the mentioned domains.
Being a user-friendly library, developers can easily benefit from a variety of benefits offered by SciPy, such as:
● Excellent support for a broad range of building blocks and operations, including high-performance computation, quality assurance
● Comes with a host of built-in functions and subroutines to get you started
● Support for algebra, calculus, differential equations,
● Support for data optimization, integration, interpolation, and modification

Matplotlib is a famous open-source graph plotting library in Python’s arsenal of tools. Matplotlib pairs well with NumPy when it comes to carrying out mathematical tasks. It offers seamless embedding options via its powerful API to integrate graphs generated with matplotlib into other applications. Some of the standout features of matplotlib include:
● Wide variety of static, animated and interactive graphs and charts to choose from
● Supports customization and exporting of the visualizations
● Allows additional toolkits including third-party ones, to extend the core functionality offered by matplotlib
● Strong community of active developers regularly contributing to the project
Google Trends — Matplotlib Interest Over Time

Seaborn is an open-source library for visualizations in Python that is based on matplotlib and offers an additional layer of customization on graphs and charts generated by matplotlib. The library strives to deliver notably informative statistical visualizations for a distinct representation of the data by operating on the dataframes and arrays and performing the relevant mapping. Some of the many features offered by seaborn are:
● Comes with an expansive collection of visualizations
● Strict control over the charts by providing tools and built-in themes
● Capable of building high-level abstractions to create complex visualizations
● API for analyzing the relationships between variables

Statsmodels is an open-source statistics-driven module that offers various classes and functions to the many statistical models available for statistical analysis and exploration of data. The module covers a vast number of models ranging from Linear Regression, Discrete Models, Time Series Analysis, Survival Analysis, and many other miscellaneous models. Some of the main features of statsmodels include:
● Offers robust statistical analysis, tests and model estimation capabilities
● Variety of tests for the model, such as goodness-of-fit, normality and more
● Support for additional models such as Robust Linear Models, Mixed Linear Models,

The Python ecosystem has loads of libraries that will help you accomplish a wide range of tasks and that too at optimum efficiency. Throughout this article, we covered just shy of a dozen high-performance top Python libraries for a wide range of domains, including Data Science and even Machine Learning and Deep Learning. Of course, the Python ecosystem is much broader than the libraries mentioned above and also covers several libraries that cater to very specific niches as well. We urge our visitors and developers to take a look into these and explore the ecosystem for newer and updated libraries if you’re looking for something specific, as newer ones keep popping up frequently.
Note: To eliminate problems of different kinds, I want to alert you to the fact this article represent just my personal opinion I want to share, and you possess every right to disagree with it.
I hope you’ve found this article useful! Below are some interesting readings hope you like them too —

Claire D. is a Content Crafter and Marketer at Digitalogy — a tech sourcing and custom matchmaking marketplace that connects people with pre-screened & top-notch developers and designers based on their specific needs across the globe. Connect with Digitalogy on Linkedin, Twitter, Instagram.
